DataElement.preferredName: Unified Modeling Language Class Object Class Relationship Administered Item Metadata CaGrid Global Model Exchange Target XML Path Language Location Administered Component Designation java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents a compilation of "best engineering practices" which have proven successful in modelling large, complex systems.:A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.:A description of the affiliation between two occurrences of Object Classes.:A registry item for which administrative information is recorded in an Administration Record.:Data about data; information that describes another set of data._A grid service that provides a repository responsible for storing and linking data models as defined within namespaces in a distributed environment. It enables other services to publish, retrieve, discover, remove, and version metadata definitions.:An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:XPath is a language that describes a way to locate and process items in Extensible Markup Language (XML) documents by using an addressing syntax based on a path through the document's logical structure or hierarchy. (from Computer, Telephony & Electronics Industry Glossary):A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.:A name by which an Administered Component is known in a specific Context. Also a placeholder to track the usage of Administered Components by different Contexts._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents a compilation of "best engineering practices" which have proven successful in modelling large, complex systems.:A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.:A description of the affiliation between two occurrences of Object Classes.:A registry item for which administrative information is recorded in an Administration Record.:Data about data; information that describes another set of data._A grid service that provides a repository responsible for storing and linking data models as defined within namespaces in a distributed environment. It enables other services to publish, retrieve, discover, remove, and version metadata definitions.:An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:XPath is a language that describes a way to locate and process items in Extensible Markup Language (XML) documents by using an addressing syntax based on a path through the document's logical structure or hierarchy. (from Computer, Telephony & Electronics Industry Glossary):A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.:A name by which an Administered Component is known in a specific Context. Also a placeholder to track the usage of Administered Components by different Contexts.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Unified Modeling Language Class Object Class Relationship Administered Item Metadata
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents a compilation of "best engineering practices" which have proven successful in modelling large, complex systems.:A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.:A description of the affiliation between two occurrences of Object Classes.:A registry item for which administrative information is recorded in an Administration Record.:Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

Concepts.definition: A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents a compilation of "best engineering practices" which have proven successful in modelling large, complex systems.
A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.
A description of the affiliation between two occurrences of Object Classes.
A registry item for which administrative information is recorded in an Administration Record.
Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

Property.preferredName: CaGrid Global Model Exchange Target XML Path Language Location Administered Component Designation
Property.preferredDefinition: A grid service that provides a repository responsible for storing and linking data models as defined within namespaces in a distributed environment. It enables other services to publish, retrieve, discover, remove, and version metadata definitions.:An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:XPath is a language that describes a way to locate and process items in Extensible Markup Language (XML) documents by using an addressing syntax based on a path through the document's logical structure or hierarchy. (from Computer, Telephony & Electronics Industry Glossary):A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.:A name by which an Administered Component is known in a specific Context. Also a placeholder to track the usage of Administered Components by different Contexts.

Concepts.definition: A grid service that provides a repository responsible for storing and linking data models as defined within namespaces in a distributed environment. It enables other services to publish, retrieve, discover, remove, and version metadata definitions.
An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.

XPath is a language that describes a way to locate and process items in Extensible Markup Language (XML) documents by using an addressing syntax based on a path through the document's logical structure or hierarchy. (from Computer, Telephony & Electronics Industry Glossary)
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.
A name by which an Administered Component is known in a specific Context. Also a placeholder to track the usage of Administered Components by different Contexts.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/10/12 jc  caDSR v4.0 model content released per direction of model owner (Denise Warzel).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
